project.title: Revenue Analysis & Strategic Planning
project.subtitle: SQL + Tableau analysis to support a streaming transition strategy

problem.what: Rockbuster Stealth LLC needed to transition from physical movie rentals to an online streaming model to compete with modern platforms.
problem.why: Leadership required data-backed answers to guide the 2020 launch strategy—what content drives revenue, where high-value customers are located, and how performance varies by region.
problem.solution: I loaded Rockbuster’s data into PostgreSQL and used SQL to analyze revenue, rentals, and customer value. Results were summarized with Tableau visuals and clear business recommendations.

keyQuestions: Which movies contributed the most and least to revenue?
What is the average rental duration for all videos?
Which countries are Rockbuster customers based in?
Where are customers with a high lifetime value based?
Do sales figures vary across geographic regions?

visualizations.title: Revenue by Rating
visualizations.subtitle: Shows how film ratings perform financially to support promotion and merchandising decisions
visualizations.insight: PG-13 generates the highest revenue, while G-rated movies earn the least.

visualizations.title: Revenue by Genre
visualizations.subtitle: Identifies the highest and lowest earning content categories to guide catalog strategy
visualizations.insight: Sports, Sci-Fi, and Animation are the top-earning genres, while Music, Travel, and Children generate the least revenue.

visualizations.title: Revenue by Country
visualizations.subtitle: Highlights which countries drive the strongest customer value and revenue contribution
visualizations.insight: India, China, the United States, Japan, and Mexico contribute the highest customer lifetime value.

keyInsights: PG-13 movies generate the highest total revenue, while G-rated movies generate the least.
Average rental duration is 5 days, with an average rental rate of $2.98 and average film length of 115 minutes.
India, China, the U.S., Japan, and Mexico represent the strongest customer lifetime value regions.
Sports, Sci-Fi, and Animation drive the most revenue; Music, Travel, and Children underperform.
recommendations: Prioritize PG-13 titles and promote other top-performing ratings to maintain a balanced catalog.
Align pricing and rental length decisions around the 5-day average customer preference.
Expand and market Sports, Sci-Fi, and Animation; use bundles/curated collections to lift weaker genres.
Focus digital growth and marketing in India, China, and the U.S. where customer value is highest.
Improve personalization and test pricing strategies to strengthen streaming conversion and retention.
project.soWhat: This analysis helps Rockbuster make a smarter streaming transition by focusing investment on the genres, ratings, and regions that drive the most revenue and customer value—supporting stronger targeting, better catalog planning, and more confident go-to-market decisions.
